subs.text: @kidehen i imagine it'd be different where you are -- but here's what i'm thinking. you try to go to your bank website and you get an error. you try to call someone and there's no dial tone. you check your email but the service isn't there. you search google but it doesn't respond.
subs.rawText: @kidehen i imagine it'd be different where you are -- but here's what i'm thinking. you try to go to your bank website and you get an error. you try to call someone and there's no dial tone. you check your email but the service isn't there. you search google but it doesn't respond.

subs.text: @kidehen i've been programming for almost 50 years. i've seen big outages, i've even caused a few via programming errors. but i don't think anyone anywhere has experienced what i described (unless of course your net connection goes down, but that's not what I'm talking about).
subs.rawText: @kidehen i've been programming for almost 50 years. i've seen big outages, i've even caused a few via programming errors. but i don't think anyone anywhere has experienced what i described (unless of course your net connection goes down, but that's not what I'm talking about).

subs.text: The problem with the Supreme Court decision is that while the constitution doesn’t specifically name abortion as a right, in order to implement a ban on abortion a state will have to violate all kinds of other rights that are specifically mentioned.
subs.rawText: The problem with the Supreme Court decision is that while the constitution doesn’t specifically name abortion as a right, in order to implement a ban on abortion a state will have to violate all kinds of other rights that are specifically mentioned.

subs.text: That’s just starting to come up in discussions here and elsewhere. It’s why they should have thought this through before issuing their edict.
subs.rawText: That’s just starting to come up in discussions here and elsewhere. It’s why they should have thought this through before issuing their edict.

subs.text: A cop approaches you on the street, arrests you and you're taken to a hospital, and one of your kidneys removed because there's a new "right to life" law. Someone needs your kidney or they'll die.
subs.rawText: A cop approaches you on the street, arrests you and you're taken to a hospital, and one of your kidneys removed because there's a new "right to life" law. Someone needs your kidney or they'll die.

subs.text: BTW, you die in the surgery to remove your kidney, too bad, that’s the way it goes.
subs.rawText: BTW, you die in the surgery to remove your kidney, too bad, that’s the way it goes.

subs.text:
Does the Supreme Court make you angry?

If so, hold on to that, and channel it into action.

And remember this country was founded in revolution, against tyranny like this.

subs.text: One of the reasons I block people who make trollish comments to things I write is to deprive them of the ability to do it again. Twitter quietly introduced another feature, short of blocking, that does it softly. You can cause someone to unfollow you. They are not notified.
subs.rawText: One of the reasons I block people who make trollish comments to things I write is to deprive them of the ability to do it again. Twitter quietly introduced another feature, short of blocking, that does it softly. You can cause someone to unfollow you. They are not notified.

When the Senate refuses to vote on a court nominee, after a certain grace period, they are assumed to have given their consent and the judge is seated. Obama never should have let McConnell get away with what he did with Garland and the lower courts. [link]
subs.rawText:
When the Senate refuses to vote on a court nominee, after a certain grace period, they are assumed to have given their consent and the judge is seated.

subs.text: Will we come to despise Christianity in the US?
subs.rawText: Will we come to despise Christianity in the US?

subs.text: I asked this question because up to this last week I felt that Christianity was other people’s problem, not mine. But they’ve captured the Supreme Court, and they’re using it to force their religion on the rest of us.
subs.rawText: I asked this question because up to this last week I felt that Christianity was other people’s problem, not mine. But they’ve captured the Supreme Court, and they’re using it to force their religion on the rest of us.

subs.text: So it’s no longer something that I can be neutral about. It seems that eventually, maybe very soon, we will come to hate Christianity.
subs.rawText: So it’s no longer something that I can be neutral about. It seems that eventually, maybe very soon, we will come to hate Christianity.
